text: This place looks like a hostel in the middle of nowhere with some containers pretending to be posh. No wifi or network connection and crazy expensive prices for a lousy accommodation. The place is ran by kids with no experience whatsoever. Looks lie they are on summer holidays. The place is dirty and was not well renovated with some weird paintings pretending to look like art. The food is a disaster. A guy cutting grass all day with terrible noise and kids in the pool with dippers shouting. Terrible experience. Place to avoid if you're looking to have some rest in a quality environment.

We (a couple) stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of October. Madeira was excellent, and we will definetly return there to see all the things we missed. The hotel though, will not be hearing or seeing any of us again so soon. I can't say that most of the staff was not helpfull and nice, because they were, but a 5 star hotel must pay attention to details in order to earn that classification, and that was not the case.In the bedroom there is no complimentary water to the guests, as happens in  most of the 5 star hotels in Portugal (continental) that I was used to; bathroom amenities are very poor; no bedroom slippers to match the bathrobes; no coffee and tea making facilities; no umbrella in the room (which would be quite handy for the sudden Madeira rain showers); Besides all this, we were supposed to have a fruit basket in the room on arrival, and that was simply \forgotten\"
month: as was my request to prepare the twin beds as a single bed (as there were no more king size bed rooms available).As I said before
year: by the second day of my stay I was already thinking that the hotel was not quite \"there\"
extracted_date_str: but was willing to accept that they where probably still on the process of \"growing\" to become the quality hotel they claim to be.This totally changed the day before we left
extracted_date: and what happened then really made me forget any plans of ever coming back to this hotel. We had payed our stay
column12: throuhg my homebanking service (the money was tranfered directly to the hotel's account)
column13: and the certificate of the payment was sent via fax o the hotel. The day before was left Madeira (10 days after the payment) we were asked
column15: to present ourselves at the reception. We found this very odd and headed there right away
column16: only to be informed that our money (that I knew was no longer in my account) had not yet reached the hotel's account. I was alarmed and immediatly asked if they had checked the certificate I sent
column17: verifying if I had tranfered the money to the correct account. They said I had made no mistake
column19: but it simply was ot there yet
column20: so they asked me very plitely if I did not mind to go to my bank agency in Funchal and check if there had been any problem tranfering the money.I did so immediatly
column22: I was ready to make a complaint at the bank
column23: because I was at this point
column24: convinced that the money probably had been mistakingly placed at a different account that the one I ordered. To my surprise
column25: when I got there they told me the money had already left their accounts
column26: and had not been misplaced anywhere else. I went to another agency
column27: this time a representative of the hotel's own bank
column28: and they confirmed me thet the money was made available at the hotel's account 6 days before.So
column30: I lost an entire morning running around Funchal
column31: only to discover that the hotel is not able to properly check their own bank account.This has never happened to me at ANY hotel
column33: let alone a 5 star. I find this unacceptable
column34: and I am truly sorry that a hotel with such potential provides this kind of service.I hope this was an isolated case
column35: because certainly if this happens to many guests they will end up with none
column36: as I surely will never return to this facility ever again."

text: We visited |villas Barrocal as a family and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The place is clean and well maintained. The staff are friendly  and we could not ask for anything more. We will surely go back there again. Not too far from the beaches and 4 minutes from N125 which gives you access to the whole of the Algarve from Sagres to Tavira!

What an amazing hotel! We wanted to move from crowded streets of Funchal and headed for western part of Madeira. Even though the hotel was all that we wanted (indoor pool, great food, spacious rooms) it still managed to surprise us with little things. Helpful staff never failed to help or support us with our stay. And location is just perfect - just a minute away from a sandy beach and the same distance of hiking trails. While hidden from major roads. We would definitely consider it again!

Just returned from a week in a 2 bed roof terrace apartment, huge space with great spec, air-con in all rooms, fully equipped kitchen that we actually used and even Skysports 1 to 5!Plenty of outdoor pool areas, great spa and just a short stroll to the brilliant beach.Food was good quality and value, even if a little short on choice.Only downside was the slightly remote location, however its a 6 euro taxi ride into Lagos Centro.Highly Recommended ....but worthwhile getting a car.

Fine for basic family holiday for young children, but not at that price. Shouldn’t be 5*.Cold pools, bad food. Lift waits too long. Staff not friendly. Not good value for money overall.Kids club was fine, and it’s okay if you want to take young children for a loud, noisy, not relaxing holiday and just eat cold chips and nuggets.

This hotel is in a stunning location. The view was the room was excellent.The service provided by the staff from check in to check out was second to none. The food at the Saturday night BBQ was fabulous.We had a deluxe room with sea view. The seaview was great. The room was a little smaller than expected but had excellent storage. It was a little tired in places but I am sure the hotel has a continuous program for re decoration and maintenance. Overall an fabulous stay and I would stay again.

All of the previous reviews have covered everything, but I loved my stay at Artbeat room so much that I had to comment too.Gosia & Gosia were lovely - friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. We arrived at 1am in the morning and they met us at the hostel no problem.We stayed in the Basquiat room and it really was beautiful. The only thing I'd say is that the street outside can be noisy, however I thought this added to the atmosphere and it's nothing a pair of earplugs can't solve.The location is amazing, right in the centre of Lisbon in a lovely area. Overall, Artbeat Rooms was a fabulous place to stay and great value and we will definitely return!

Me and my friend booked this hotel as we just wanted a clean room to sleep in as we wouldn’t be in the room very often with doing activities most of the day, however we got much more! Very warm welcome as soon as we arrived at the hotel by receptionist who gave us all the information we needed. Hotel is in the centre of Funchal in a nice area, not loud at all for a good nights sleep and the balcony rooms have a shutter to stop light, not sure about the other rooms. The room was very clean with comfy beds and lots of storage space for clothes. Towels provided for sunbeds and bathroom. Bathroom decent size to put toiletries out on the side of the sink and in shower. The rooftop has great views of Funchal and good spot to sunbathe with a small pool. Also has a restaurant, which we only tried once but couldn’t fault from what we had. Many options for breakfast with hot food, pastries, cereals, fruit and more which was served from 7:30-10:30. Staff always topping up any food that had ran out straight away. Overall, a great place to stay with friendly staff and clean rooms.

Serra Golf is, as the name suggests, close to one of the major golf courses in Madeira and it is obviously a great hotel for golfers but we found it an ideal spot for walkers. The village is over 600 meters above sea level on a volcanic plateau so there are walks close at hand either directly from the hotel or a short taxi ride away. The hotel keeps a file of suggested walks and walkers are generous in sharing their experiences.The Sera Golf is a small (22rooms) recently refurbished hotel with good well appointed rooms, a lounge and small indoor pool. We used the suite which opens directly onto the gaden but other rooms have small balconies for a quiet read after an active day. The garden is quite small but we found that this meant that guests talked to each other. This was also the case in the restaurant which was friendly, light and comfortable.The staff at Serra Golf were also friendly and helpful. Because the hotel is small they share the jobs that need to be done which means we felt we got to know them because they were serving at table, helping with directions, switching on the sauna, or booking a taxi or dealing with any problem.If you want a quiet hotel in the country in Madeira we recommend Serra Golf and if you must have the shops it is not that far to Funchal!

the front door staff is just amazing. so helpful, cheerful all the time. very attentive to our needs. it made the stay wonderful. didn't love the part of town, but despite that, 15 minutes walk to the center square, and the boutique hotel experience worth it. breakfast was SO good, healthy. still thinking about their cappuccino..

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon to find our room wasn't ready. Hotel staff suggested we go to the pool - when we asked where we could get changed they told us there wasn't anywhere - how utterly ridiculous.We stayed in one of the older rooms which was adequate but we had paid slightly extra for a sea view - the view turned out to be a roof with air on units on with the sea in the very very far distance - upon approaching staff about this matter they told us they only had partial sea view rooms - this was at no point made clear during the booking process !!!!!!!The service round the pool was appalling, as was the cleanliness. When we went out for dinner on an evening the pool area was a disgrace empty bowls, plates, glasses and dirty towels were littered around the pool area.There was only one day during our week stay where we managed to get a sun lounger by the pool - many had towels on with no owner in site. The towel staff were also incredibly unhelpful.The pool had no room to swim in, as it was filled with inflatables, and screaming kids. On one occasion I moved numerous inflatables out the way to get into the pool when a staff member came and put them back in the pool so I couldn't get in.We spoke to staff about the disappointed with our stay and they didn't seem surprised.I certainly WILL NOT back - they are charging 5 star prices for what is a 2/3 star hotel.The only bright note was that there was a trainee member of staff - pedro. He was helpful and friendly and actually appeared to be doing some work unlike the majority of his colleagues.

We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. The hotel is small with a cute bar and a lovely restaurant where an excellent breakfast was served. The bed was the most comfortable we selp in through out our tripStaff couldn't do enough to help you out. So friendly. Free drink at bar at arrival bathroom was gorgeous. We sadly only stay one night here on our honeymoon trip but they gave us a bottle of sparkling wine to celebrate our honeymoon.We would definitely stay here again when we are in lisbon.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: Staff was incredibly kind and helpful.   Almost every dish served was either without flavor or poorly made.  The soup was just spinach and water, served luke warm and the Cesar dressing was just mayonnaise as two examples.  Rooms were topically clean but very dark, beds were comfortable,  closet space was very awkward.  The lovely people working here made the stay nice but otherwise it was just average.  Should be 4 star.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: A group of friends and I returned to see the hotel and eat in the restaurant after it had been refurbished.It is still very friendly but I did not like the decor.The bar has lost its cosy atmosphere. There are no longer littler alcoves to sit and chat with friends. No more sofas to sit on and have a pre dinner drink. It has a bright sparkly look about it but I prefer what was there before.The restaurant is still serving good quality food but I did not feel the service was as good a level as my previous visits. I think they had young waiters still learning their skills and were not yet up to speed.

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Châteaux
text: Far from everything in an incredible environment, the view of the vineyards and the river at this time is magnificent. Perfect welcome, a beautiful house where you want to stay calm. The restaurant is very nice with very attentive but relaxed service and good local cuisine. Thank you for this parenthesisXavier and Alicia

Beautiful hotel in a lively part of town.The rooms are very well maintained and comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming!The breakfast is extensive and so, so delicious!A fantastic stay!We'll be back!

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Châteaux
text: This is a fantastic hotel in the most beautiful setting.We decided to treat ourselves by booking Quinta Nova for a one night stay during a week long road trip around northern Portugal and are really pleased we did.After checking in and being shown to our stunning room with a view (overlooking the gorgeous valley) we decided to attend the complimentary wine tour.  Our guide Sandra was great. We are both novice wine enthusiasts and Sandra provided the most informative and enjoyable tour from start to  finish. The wine tasting at the end isn't free but is well worth it (definitely get the cheese board as well).The attention to detail throughout the hotel is immaculate & the staff couldn't do anymore to assist but the real highlight is without doubt the views into the valley and  endless vines. Sitting outside with a bottle of wine surrounded by such beauty was breathtaking.Whilst the hotel did have some construction work being undertaken, it didn't interfere with our stay. The only small negative was that we weren't allowed to use the pool (we didn't know that it's not open all year round). Otherwise we couldn't recommend a stay at Quinta Nova any more.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We have just returned home from another wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel.  This was our third visit.  Our welcome was warm and friendly and we were shown to our room with views over the gardens to the harbour and sea.  Very comfortable with everything you would need for your stay.  The whole hotel is extremely relaxing with lots of lovely sitting areas, and a small boutique.  Outside are two pools and sitting area. All of the staff are most welcoming, efficient, helpful and friendly.  Breakfasts are fantastic to begin your day with an array of delicious fresh foods to choose from.  There is also a menu for other cooked items you may like.  Afternoon tea is a delight served on the balcony overlooking the gardens and the sea.  We booked dinner in the Italian restaurant a few steps from the main hotel but in the same grounds.  The food there is delicious. It is just a wonderful relaxing hotel to stay in while in Madeira.  We enjoyed every minute of it, and, all being well, we hope to return again in 2025.  Thank you very much to all the lovely staff. xx

My son and I had been traveling in Portugal and wisely spent our final day at the Marriott.  It was close to the airport, had an excellent Executive Lounge, was very clean and the staff were excellent.  One of the door men helped us multiple times including an intervention with our cab driver to ensure we received the correct change.  On multiple occasions, he asked us how were doing and the other hotel staff were friendly and helpful as well. Our major regret is that we didn’t spend more time in Lisbon at the Marriott. Great stay.

Pros:  In the heart of a busy street that does not allow cars and has many shops and restaurants close by.Newly remodeled apartment and everything is in working order and decent supplies in the small kitchen plus a microwave and dishwasher.Large LED TV with many English channels including The Family Guy which is great at 3am when I could not sleep.Small bedroom but ample light with the two large windows.Living room has two large windows as well.New bathroom so the plumbing worked well.Subway and train lines close by and within walking distance.No noise from the other apartments in the building and the AC unit worked well and was quiet.Cons: staff except the lovely maid who cleaned the apartment had zero customer service skills. We buzzed the intercom one hour before the 4pm check in time and were barked at to go away and that the apartment would not be available before 4pm.  Almost rude.There is a very long set of stairs to climb before you have access to the elevator so if you are carrying luggage get ready.The mattress was not big enough for two adult people even though it was advertised as a double.  One of us wound up on the couch so we could sleep without being on top of each other.   Also the mattress was lumpy and uncomfortable.  No extra blankets were provided just the one comforter for the bed.Because of the location and pedestrian walkway the noise from the street was a constant roar 7/24.   We closed the windows and metal shutters which helped but because it is a very old building the noise proofing is pretty poor.  So bring ear plugs if you hope to sleep.But what bothered us the most was the updated instruction email we received two days before our arrival was filled with warnings about the owners are not responsible for any thefts and that guests are required to protect their belongings and valuables in the safe.  We were instructed to lock all windows to the unit and the metal shutters when not there.  So clearly they had some level of break ins for the units. The safe was really small so I could not fit my iPad in it and had to carry it around during our stay.  The email made us wary of

What a wonderful place for a quiet retreat!Extremely cosy, really friendly and professional staff, great food and in a breathtaking location, certainly a great pick for a stay in Madeira.I highly recommend this place.

This hotel is a luxury hotel at a not so high price.  The staff was so friendly and helpful and made our stay very pleasant.  It is in walking distance to most shops and the river as well as restaurants.  We were there for business meetings and they were so accommodating including we had one person become ill in which they called the hotel doctor and then had someone go out to get a prescription filled for my colleague.  Rooms are very new and modern and with lots of outlets to plug things in.  All Excellent.  Fitness room has nice equipment but not much.  Pool is beautiful.

A good LocationFriendly StaffMuch Improved foodOur family and then our Children and their family have used Fairways as a home from home for more than 20 years.  If you want a taste of the Algarve at an affordable price Fairways is worth a visit

date: O T Dwrote a review Apr 2017
text: Very nice hotel! We had a deluxe room with a big terrace outside. Next to the lift, but that didn't bother us (great sound insulation!). Breakfast was excellent. Great bed, lots of pillows. Fitness center and pool in the basement: Nice!We had breakfast in the room one morning, which the staff botched up. Food enough for at least 5 persons (we were only two) but no coffee. When the coffee finally arrived it was old and stale and undrinkable. The Nespresso machine in the room was okay, but why does a hotel in this price range charge 2,50 EUR pr capsule? Quite unnecessary and very irritating. We were there for five nights. The last 36 hours without any housekeeping, which we then had to ask for.

What can I say about the Hyatt Regency in Lisbon, Portugal, except that our stay there was excellent?  The staff was always available to take care of our needs, and their hospitality was exceptional.  This hotel is by far one of the best places we've stayed where the staff truly puts their customers first with their pleasant and professional care.  The restaurant staff and culinary delights were outstanding.  The GM of the restaurant/hotel was always there to accommodate our wishes.   Lastly, the Health SPA (Serenity) staff and their amenities were fabulous.  The staff at the Health SPA went way above and beyond our expectations to perform the \Art of Wellbeing\"  for us after our daily tours.  Relaxing in their Thermal Oasis
extracted_date: if you plan a trip to Lisbon
sentiment_score: and you don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of the City and want to branch out to other areas Portugal has to offer
column12: I highly recommend staying at the  Hyatt Regency."

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: Upon checking in, I was impressed with how welcoming everyone was.  We were given a map of the city and the staff orientated us to the city and things to do and see. Our 5th floor room was a Jr. Suite which accommodated my family of 3 perfectly.  Hotel Valverde has top-notch service.  Late one evening as we were returning to the hotel after a long day of site seeing, my son and I were craving an original custard tart from Pasteis de Nata located in Belem.  These tarts are delicious, but it is a cab ride away.  Fernando greeted us at the door as we were returning and heard us talking about the tarts.  We went to the hotel bar for a glass of vino and shortly after Fernando walked in with three tarts!!  He went to Belem specifically for us!  Fernando also arranged a private site seeing tour for us of the Palaces.  The staff in the restaurant was equally as wonderful and attentive.  Many thanks to Crystal for getting us desserts that weren't offered on the menu.  We truly enjoyed Hotel Valverde and would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Lisbon!

It is maybe a old house, but it was very clean. A nice Area. We feel very good. I had only a little probleme to the conection with wifi. But later every things was ok.The food coud be a little bit more differents things and changing more every days. But was ok....

Beautiful scenery, fantastic service poolside, magnificently designed room, excellent views from rooftop bar, food delivery and tasty flavors.  Wonderful dive shop below the pool to get certified is incredibly amazing!

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: We were excited about this place when we booked it, and it turned out to be better than expected! We stayed for 4 nights in late October (which was delightfully quiet and peaceful, yet with flowers still in bloom) in room #10 on the second floor, in the main villa property. First impressions: our room was beautiful and spacious. We were delighted by the tasteful decor, gorgeous wood furnishings, and balcony with a fantastic view, which made for a great place to enjoy the complimentary and nicely-chilled bottle of wine. Walking to and from our room was a delight in and of itself, with the property's meandering walking paths, pool/lounge areas, foliage, and singing birds. The breakfast was a great way to start the day, with plenty of local foods (and pastries, omg) and good coffee in a relaxing setting. Best of all, the location of this property was perfectly situated for us, as we planned to do a lot of walking and hiking around the area. We chose not to rent a car, which may not be the right call for some but worked out perfectly for us. As long as you're up for a decent amount of walking, you can get to a ton of beaches, trails, restaurants and the downtown area from this villa, and you can call an Uber anytime if needed. The streets around the villa aren't equally lit up at night, but it never felt unsafe to me. We absolutely loved this place and we would recommend it in a heartbeat -- and definitely plan to come back!

It was a great disappointment that some hotels get away with murder.....calling itself a resort hotel, is a complete no go. I worked as executive Chef in Resorts of Hilton, Intercontinental and Sheraton hotels, this was a joke.Wikipadia resort: A resort (North American English) is an isolated place,self-contained commercial establishment that tries to provide most of a vacationer's wants, such as food, drink, lodging, sports, entertainment, and shopping, on the premises. The term resort may be used for a hotel property that provides an array of amenities, typically including entertainment and recreational activities.This was a very dark place like you feel in the lobby, entering a morgue, dark and uninviting, the corridors to the rooms a so dark, you feel frustrated straight away. We booked a week via jet2holidays to get away from the grey days of UK. But on arrival of this so called 5star Savoy hotel in the middle of nowhere, 50 km away from Funchal, where the life of the capital should bei, there was a friendly staff member who checked us into our room, facing a wall, with no sumlight at all, my wife who booked our holiday started crying.....we went to reception to explain our concerns about the room, and after a while \given that we are full
month: I have another option for you\" we had a long walk and made it to room 546 at the end of all corridors
year: we had a balcony and a side view to the sea. Thank you
extracted_date_str: we obviously agreed to the room with at least some natural sun light.The design leaves a lot to desire
extracted_date: given that your room has a hand wash basin at the entrance of the room
year_int: then a walk in shower with glass panels
sentiment_score: frosted glass to the height of 4 foot without door
column12: overlooking your wife or partner on the bed. Not any rooms are suitable for colleagues who do not want to share that views. No door available. The toilet room is further down with a sliding glass door again frosted glass to just 4 foot. with a toilet and opposite 3 meter away a Pidet.The only mirror for your wife to put some make up on is the one at the entrance about 70 cm away behind the sink. The sink is one of these new modern very shallow ones
column13: every thing swims behind it after you washed your face.There is no entertainment what so ever in the hotel
column14: no shops or anything else that reminds you on a a resort hotel. They paid more attention to the architect maintains his original idea of trying to maintain the charme of the old sugarcane mill
column15: which doesn't mean that the paying customers are going to enjoy the comfort of the hotel. The rooms where serviced by around 5.30 pm given that this was for us the very first time in our 40 years of hospitality experience in resort and city hotels
column16: that the rooms where serviced that late.Given that you are situated in the middle of no where
column17: there is a daily bus service provided by the hotel for the amount of 20 euro per person to the capital of Funchal. This is needless to say found by most the customers a rip off. There a a marina with a few restaurants near the hotel and a supermarket to by some stuff you assumed is available at the resort shops.....sun lotion or any souvenirs or anything else.The restaurants: if I would have served the Luke warm food at any of our resort hotels I would have been fired. The breakfast selection was good nothing wrong with it
column18: but given that in the EU we have certain health and safety standards
column20: and therefor these rules should apply as to all European countries
column21: ) I am positive that a Nora virus is never far away from it.The swimming pools are beautiful with only one back draw none of the pools a more then 3.4 ft deep
column22: which make swimming more difficult for tall people
column23: the images of the hotel have been massaged to give a wow effect.If I want to have something about the history of the place I go to a museum or look at some pictures of the property.The reply comments to this will be a very typical Standart one
column24: as to all other previous customers
column25: \" we aim at the highest Standart and customer satisfaction and we feel sorry that we did not meet your requirement......this is just not good enaugh given that our holiday was not cheap. And be rest assured that many more customers will complain. The owning company will need to take serious action to fulfil future Savoy customers needs
column32: Practically there is nothing to say, except rave reviews. The best hotel. All at the highest level. Lovely rooms, cleaning twice a day, free drinks at the bar. One of the best restaurants, especially Chepriani. The best territory, a huge garden, wonderful SPA.

text: Found this amazing terrace bar - superb views -they also have a rooftop bar which unfortunately wasn’t open. But the terrace is perfect for a romantic afternoon cocktail. Didn’t try it but the “One” restaurant has a very interesting menu.

This is one of the more established hotels in Funchal, full of returning visitors and experienced, friendly staff. The construction of the new Savoy Palace - a Dubai-style behemoth across the road - has thankfully not had a negative impact. Indeed, it’s added to the drinking and dining options (Royal Savoy residents can access the hotel by walking across the sky bridge and using their keycards at the gate). You can also use their more extensive spa.However, for our tastes, the Royal Savoy is infinitely better. The pool area is its star attraction: two irregularly shaped and sizeable heated pools, with recliners both poolside and sequestered away in little private areas. There’s also easy and direct access to the sea for a more bracing swim if you fancy it. Poolside snacks are tasty if a little on the expensive side.The food is perhaps the one area where the quality dips slightly - the evening a la carte meals we had at both the Armada and Neptunus restaurants were disappointing for the price. Also, the breakfast buffet has great variety but the hot food was never very hot. The pastries were delicious though.The communal areas have been updated recently (not the rooms, which remain charming and comfortable) and there’s a new piano bar by reception called Thatchers. Any ambiguity about the name is soon put to rest by the cocktail menu, featuring such belters as ‘The Conservative’ and ‘The Falklands’. She came here on her holidays, apparently, and while I’m sure the hotel thought this was just a bit of fun (and indeed it’s probably a source of great pride for many of the English regulars) it put this adoptive Scot off his drink somewhat…Staff are universally lovely and helpful. The cleaning staff are excellent and our room was frequently and consistently tidied and turned down.There were some lift issues while we were here - two of the four main elevators were out of order - and this was problematic given we were encouraged to limit occupancy to two at a time due to COVID-19. These things happen, I suppose, but I was surprised the issue wasn’t resolved as a matter of urgency.But overall this was a very pleasant stay and we look forward to returning soon.

This hotel has been completely refurbished to a high standard. As you walk in, the white paint everywhere draws you in through nice features of Long corridors, and unique design. It is extremely stylishly thought out and bar area most comfortable.The views are simply stunning of the cliff line and sea.Staff were very sweet, and whilst we only had a quick drink I have to say it had a real luxury feel to it. You could see from the clientele that it is arguably more suited to people of a high financial disposition as drinks were also on the pricey side. But with a view like this, at times you get what you pay for indeed.

We loved our stay at the Royal Savoy. We had a suite on the third floor with an enormous balcony overlooking the pool area and the sea beyond. With six adults and a baby, we had more than enough space. The suite is nicely furnished with a well equipped kitchen and beautiful big bathrooms.The staff are pleasant, especially the bar staff who couldn't be friendlier or more helpful.Food and drink may be more costly than elsewhere in Funchal but cheaper than the UK and of very high quality.We particularly loved the sea water pool and enjoyed the opportunity to swim in the sea from the rocks beyond the hotel pool.Try a buffet night at the restaurant and enjoy a Gin and Tonic in the Piano Bar.

Stayed for nearly a couple of weeks at Easter. We chose the hotel primarily for its location, half way between the strip and the old town. Checking in took a little longer than we expected, initially there was only one guy and a queue started to form, but then he was helped by another person. The information offered at check in wasn't the most extensive, and there wasn't the usual book or folder in the room telling about the hotel - you have to find things out yourself. There are A4 notices on reception and in the lift, but you have to ask a lot.Then it gets better. The one bed roomed apartment was very clean, had loads of room and has two TVs. The large beds were comfortable and the curtains can prevent all light getting in so its easy to sleep. Kitchen was well equipped, we went self catering and used the kitchen for breakfast. There is a small supermarket slightly down the hill and about 150 yards away. The lounge area has a couple of fairly comfortable wrap around chairs and sofa bed.There are four lifts for four floors so it was never necessary to wait very much. The bar was on the bottom floor and had no door. The open layout of the hotel, imagine the inside of the prison in Porridge, meant the noise from the entertainment spread throughout the hotel. Invariably it went quiet before midnight.Pool area was large and plenty of sun beds. There are two pools,Mobutu only one had water in. The larger one was being retiled throughout our stay. There was a pool bar, but in early season it was never open. The pool are couch have done with a sweep, surprising because everywhere else was spotless.Lastly the staff are wonderful. Overall great Time and we will come back.

Scenery beautiful. Food in general very good, both the breakfast buffet and a la carte restaurant. The sky bar is an amazing setting (although maybeeeee get a DJ who doesn’t play YMCA and ABBA). We had a nice spa treatment as well.On the slightly negative side the WiFi more or less just doesn’t work, and there’s minimal mobile service in rooms. So if you need to work or just want to check in then you’re a bit isolated.Would have been nice to see more pool side service.I assume not their fault given national park guidance but the walk down to the beach (hotel up on a cliff) is v dangerous. Broken fences, steps, handrails, etc. You need to be pretty athletic to do it.

â€¢Firstly, the food is reasonable.â€¢The staff is super unfriendly, out of 10 people from the staff if 1 person is friendly it's lucky.â€¢The sofa bed and the beds themselves are very uncomfortable.â€¢The cleaning was bad, and the lady who came to clean hardly spoke to us.â€¢The location is very good.â€¢Worst of all were the cockroaches, in 1 week we found at least 5 or 6 cockroaches inside our room. These appeared mostly at night when we were sleeping, we always woke up in the middle of the night to kill them. Right now I'm the best friend of cockroachesðŸ™„ðŸ™„ I will share some pictures of them.

Just spent 3 nights here, room was amazing, all parts of the hotel very clean, staff all lovely, breakfast great choice something for everyone, fantastic location. I have not got a negative word to say and will definitely be returning next year.

It’s very difficult to write down in words how amazing this hotel is! The building itself stands out, beautiful, modern but also keeping the traditions. The view….. magical!!!! You wake up and you see the ocean in front of you and dramatic cliffs and a waterfall on your right! The service was excellent, the stuff very friendly and helpful and we even got an upgrade on our room! There’s a nice garden and patio to enjoy the sun, a cute outdoor pool and another area with an indoor pool and jacuzzi in which you can relax while still enjoying the view.We had dinner at the restaurant and the octopus and desert were delicious! So as the breakfast! It’s a must stay for anyone staying in Madeira!

If you would like a nice rest this is the place for you . Rooms are so big kitchen great with ever think you need . We have been going for past 8 years . Never let's you Down . You just fall in to holiday as soon as you get there . Staff go out of there way to help you . Rooms Are very clean . We will be going back

We stayed at the Pedras do Mar for 8 days. The rooms were nice and clean, the indoor pool was fantastic and views were stunning. Breakfast was excellent,hot and cold buffet with many items to choose from. The only complaint that I have is that the blonde breakfast employee was beyond rude. Every morning she was moody, never once said good morning,obviously she didn't like her job very much and shouted to my wife who looked for a table saying 'Hey room number!!' You don't expect to be spoken to like that in a 5 star hotel. Would not stay here again.

Just listened to the evening entertainment, Mauro Silva, he was brilliant, very entertaining but what a voice, sang Disturbed's version of 'Sound of silence' on my request with the deepness it requires and had a standing ovation. Keep it up, many more people will enjoy your voice.

Stayed in a studio and had everything we needed. Nice kitchen so you can keep snacks and more space than a hotel. There's a lot within walking distance. Plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. About 15 min walk to lovely praia de oura (beach). Plenty of free parking if you hire a car. The complex felt safe and secure and in a good area just far enough away from the strip to keep noise down. Would stay here again. My only complaint was the beds weren't comfortable but that's my only negative comment. Loved it!

Right so we arrived 4 hours late meant to be here at 8 but rolled in at midnight was a long day....The gentleman on reception well what can I say must of been having a bad day. Wasn't very welcoming.Apartments are great everything you need. We did have to pay Â£206 to upgrade as jet 2 had put us on a crappy room. The Â£100 euros Was not a problem.So first night was good we were so tired we slept like babies (beds are actually OK).Not sure what they mean about no large groups as there are a few here at the moment., unfortunately next to us, loud when getting ready to go out around midnight and even louder around 5am!!! On their return.Will wait and see what tonight brings.....

It’s almost 3 hours from Lisbon nestled below a hill. Beautiful views all across the estate. They have cows, bulls, sheep, horses, etc in the estate.We had a 3 bedroom apartment which was very nicely done up. Minimalistic but nice. They haves preserved the exteriors from 100+ years.It is good to walk around the estate and just hang out. Good family time. They have an awesome spa and the therapists are really good too.Where they lack is in overall service and the food. I think since staff is not comfortable in English they tend not to respond well to queries especially when we were ordering for food etc in the room.Also, the food was a huge disappointment.  Apart from breakfast, all our meals were quite average. They have limited options and even within the options the food is not good. They need to improve this are.

Just returned from Tavira, hotel very clean, staff friendly, rooms great size and comfortable. Take your own towel though as they charge a rental per day, we went over to the local shop opposite hotel and bought 2 towels so less hastle. Breakfasts plentiful great selection on the buffet lasted us all day.The hotel can be noisy so as advised we did take ear plugs, we were on the ground floor and we had alady in high heal shoes above, clip clop so be warned. If you are looking for a great meal go to Restaurante 'QUATRO AQUAS' fantastic ask for Freddie he will look after you advisable to book only 5 euros in a taxi from the hotel.

It was a treat to stay at Altis Belem. Fabulous room, spacious, huge bed and lovely seating area. It is in a quieter location with a great bar overlooking the river. Belem Tower is next door! Walkable to other restaurants and accessible by a ten minute taxi into the centre.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel in August 2005.  Everything about it was excellent.  The staff were some of the most friendly, polite and helpful we have ever come across,they made us feel very welcome and made our stay a very pleasant one.  The rooms are spacious and we had a lovely balcony overlooking the pool which incidentally was wonderful - never too crowded even in august.  Tavira itself is a lovely relaxed town with good places to eat in the evening.  It's worth crossing the roman bridge to find some excellent restaurants on the other side. The beach (accessed by boat) is tranquil and if you're prepared to walk for 10 minutes from where you get off the boat you can find a little space all to yourself.  I'd recommend taking a few supplies with you ie. food and water as there's not really any places to buy stuff on the beach itself.  We would definitely reccommend Tavira and the Vila Gale Hotel!

Had read previous reviewer's opinion and decided to give it a go due to quality/price ratio and I was not disapointed.Went there as part of an Easyjet package holiday so very cheap (GBP 250 flight and hotel for 6 nights)  so was not expecting too much. However after an 8Euros taxi ride from the airport i got to a very pleasant hotel and reception.I had requested a double room but was told it would be a twin room for the 1st night and a change after that. my twin bed was hard but the room well appointed with a good batroom on the street side. Double room (both on 5th floor) was on terrace siDe and just as good even quieter with again a good bathroom.Used buffet breakfast twice good value for money too. Room service is cheap and good too.Well situated for site seeing between 2 metro stations and transport is cheap.A definite must when in Lisbon.

How many hotels introduce you to the staff on arrival and are there on departure to give you a hug ? Extremely friendly and well run. Nothing is too much trouble. Many of the guests come back year after year and would go nowhere else . Neither would I.

Beautiful hotel, modern, breathtaking views of Rio Douro.But make sure to bring your passport or foreign Id.Check your exit receipts, they might want to charge you for overnight parking, which they attempted to even though it was inclusive in my Priceline reservation, other then that it was a pleasant stay! Comfortable bed and pillows.

Good location near the strip but not too close and not too far from old town about 5 euro in a taxi. Views not great from balcony near a busy road but overall a great place very clean and staff very helpful.

V enjoyable stay. We were a group of 11 staying in the hotel, the staff were fantastic, friendly, very helpful and fun. No request was too much trouble. The rooms were spotless, comfy beds. Great power shower too. Would I stay here again? Yes!

Such a great hostel! Right in the centre of Lisbon - The staff are so friendly, helpful and easygoing. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and the atmosphere is great. We didnt want to leave!! Cant recommend it highly enough!

The hotel was very central to all the main sights, restaurants and shopping. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The breakfast was good and the room was spacious and clean. If you are doing a weekend in Lisbon I would highly recommend this hotel

Everyone was so nice and accommodating. I could not have been happier!  And I look forward to returning for my next stay soon again! And my dog especially loved it! The garden was absolutely splendid! Loved the ducks!

I stayed here for a week during a trip to Lisbon and felt truly at home at this hotel. The hotel rooms are spacious with modern bathrooms, and the cleaners did a wonderful job each day and were so respectful of our things. The hotel staff at the reception and breakfast areas are warm and helpful, and genuinely seemed happy to help with any questions. The breakfast was absolutely delicious: each day we had a great spread of fruits, hot and cold items, delicious coffees including con leche, and pastries, all seasoned to perfection. The care, customer service, and happy demeanor of the hotel staff really made our stay a positive one, along with the great amenities in the hotel itself. I'd be more than willing to stay here again during any future visits to Lisbon!

It was a family travel and the main goal was to rest and get absorbed by the nature. The commodities were very good, the rooms were spacious and the pool also was very large and clean.The breakfast was very good and also the dinner, with amazing typical Alentejo food. The opportunity to be close to the farm animals was very good and for the kids were absolutely amazing. The dogs walking around the farm were very sweet.The hosts were very attentive and kind.Definitely we want to come again.

We stayed at this Vila Gale Hotel for a couple of times. This time we came for the Endocrinology Congress 2016, well organized and with great food!It was nice to see that in comparison to the previous year that we had spent 2 nights, this time the Wi Fi internet was was Free and great throughout the hotel. Breakfast with a vast list of options as usual.. Not really in the center of Coimbra, but easily walkable! I recommend it !

Great location, great breakfast, nice rooms at a reasonable price.  At the beginning of Avenida de Libertade, across the street from the M. Pombal metro stop, you can get anywhere you will want to go very quickly.  Taxis always right outside the front door.  7-8 euro taxi ride from airport, and to most places we went in Lisbon.  The breakfast has an incredible array of choices: meats, cheeses, fruit, breads, cereal.  Also included some atypical choices: tomatoes, cucumbers, champagne, pizza, pasteles de nata.  The espresso machines cranked out hundreds of cups each day.  The breakfast is on floor -1, but still gets natural light from an atrium through HF's middle.  Large breakfast room, looks like it seats 150-200.  The staff is outstanding!  I never saw anything run out, and there was always plenty of plates, cups, silverware, etc.  I commend HF management for investing in enough hard-working, friendly staff.  Our room, including breakfast for the two of us, was 120 euro per night.  A great bargain.

Literally the worst customer service I have ever encountered!For a relatively expensive hotel I expect the staff to be helpful and friendly. When I had an issue with my booking their reservation staff could offer no support whatsoever. Might as well have been dealing with robots!

In a busy city like Lisbon, you can't wait to have some space of your own. Finding the ideal package is the cherry on top of the cake. My sister and I spent a wonderful afternoon at Altis BelÃ©m & SPA. We enjoy the sunny hours by the pool and, when the sun went down, we too headed down to the SPA where we enjoy the indoor swimming pool, steam room and sauna. They have complimentary snacks and fruity waters by the indoor pool.Fantastic staff and beautiful, luminous environment.

To our shame it appears that we have not written a review since July 2015 despite many visits since then. Without any doubt the management and staff of this hotel provide a peerless level of service. We brought a small matter surrounding wheelchair access to the manager yesterday and by today it had been resolved. That is a truly outstanding example of customer service.You need to experience it to believe it, don’t hesitate.

Just back and enjoyed it so much we are looking to book again. What beautiful accommodation - spotlessly clean and fantastic location. Pool is wonderful! View from our apartment, on our wonderful balcony, were just perfect. Thank you!

Very pleasant hotel. Good facilities, good cleaning and good service. Its location is great, in front of Amado beach, which despite being small is very welcoming. Good price/quality ratio. Hotel to enjoy in the future.

A great hotel for the family in an historic building in the centre of Viseu. Great rooms and friendly service . Beautiful pool but Spa needs to be updated/redesigned. Food at the hotel is delicious and not expensive.

I am very happy with our stay in this hotel. Excellent location only one minute to the beach, close to the shops and restaurants, friendly staff, tasty breakfast, very clean and modern. The cleaning staff doing excellent job, rooms are spotless every day. Definitely recommend!
